Description: The Ohio Valley Coal Company (OVCC) pleaded guilty before a U.S. Magistrate Judge to criminal violations of the Clean Water Act arising from two coal slurry release incidents that polluted Captina Creek in Belmont County, Ohio. OVCC operates a mining facility in Alledonia, Ohio. OVCC was sentenced to pay a criminal fine of $500,000 to the United States and $87,000 in restitution to the Ohio EPA for the analysis and protection of Captina Creek.
